required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Epidemiological Investigation of Sepsis in Obstetrics Admitted to ICU
clinical_study.official_title: Epidemiological Investigation of Sepsis in Obstetrics Admitted to ICU From 2008 to 2016 in Beijing China: A First Multicenter Report

brief_summary.textblock: Sepsis is still the main cause of maternal death, accounting for 11% of maternal deaths. Early identification of high risk factors of sepsis and early intervention can improve the prognosis of pregnant women with sepsis. At present, there is no epidemiological investigation report on sepsis in ICU in China.

detailed_description.textblock: Although great progress has been made in maternal care in China in recent years, the maternal mortality rate in China has remained high in the past three years, fluctuating from 19.6-20.1/100000, and there is still a large gap between China and developed countries (12.1/100000). Sepsis is still the main cause of maternal death, accounting for 11% of maternal deaths; Early identification of high risk factors of sepsis and early intervention can improve the prognosis of pregnant women with sepsis. At present, there is no epidemiological investigation report on sepsis in ICU in China. A total of 160 cases of maternal sepsis with ICU admission in any trimester of pregnancy or within 42 days of delivery were reviewed between January 1, 2008, and December 31, 2019. The demographic data including age and gestational age, mode of delivery, the maximal SOFA score, invasive operation before sepsis, sepsis focuses, intervention, microbial culture results, body temperature and blood routine were reviewed to investigate the incidence and mortality of maternal sepsis in intensive care unit, as well as the incidence of multidrug-resistant bacteria and the risk factors of multidrug resistance.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of Maternal sepsis in intensive care unit
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of Maternal sepsis in ICU represents as proportion based on the total number of of maternal ICU admissions and is expressed per 100 deliveries.
Sepsis related maternal mortality in hospitals represents as proportion based on the total number of maternal sepsis in intensive care units and is expressed per 100,000 deliveries.

The incidence of multidrug resistance represents as proportion based on the total number of of maternal sepsis in ICU and is expressed per 100 deliveries. Multidrug resistance was defined as acquired non-susceptibility to at leas one agent in three or more antimicrobial categories.

secondary_outcome.description: The date of transferring to wards or death minus the date of ICU admission

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group with sepsis complicated with multidrug-resistant bacteria
arm_group.description: Obstetrics diagnosed with sepsis were divided to group with sepsis complicated with multidrug-resistant bacteria if microbial culture results showed multidrug-resistance.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group with sepsis complicated with none multidrug-resistant bacteria
arm_group.description: Obstetrics diagnosed with sepsis were divided to group with sepsis complicated with none multidrug-resistant bacteria if microbial culture results showed none-multidrug-resistance or no positive result of microbial culture.

intervention.description: Multidrug resistance was defined as acquired non-susceptibility to at leas one agent in three or more antimicrobial categories.
intervention.arm_group_label: Group with sepsis complicated with multidrug-resistant bacteria

study_pop.textblock: Obstetrics with sepsis in any trimester of pregnancy or within 42 days of delivery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Obstetrics with sepsis in any trimester of pregnancy or within 42 days of delivery -
Exclusion Criteria: The electronic medical record is lost. Patients with incomplete infection data: if the temperature sheet is ambiguous and the temperature data is not recorded in the medical record.
-
